Packet Sniffer Documentation¶

This is the documentation for the Packet Sniffer project (pktsniffer.py).

Modules¶

CSCI-651 HW 1: Packet Sniffer

Implementing a packet sniffer program which sniffs and extracts data from a .pcap file from WireShark.

author: SAMYAK RAJESH SHAH

pktsniffer.filter_packets(args)¶

Method for filtering the packets according to the args provided.

Parameters:

args – Command Line args provided for filtering

Returns:

None

pktsniffer.has_layer(pkt, layer_name)¶

Helper method for checking if packet has the given layer.

Parameters:

  • pkt – Current Packet

  • layer_name – Layer Name to be checked

Returns:

True if layer exists, False otherwise

pktsniffer.packet_matches_filters(pkt, args)¶

Helper method to filter the packet given the command line args.

Parameters:

  • pkt – Current packet

  • args – Command Line args

Returns:

True if packet matches args, False otherwise

pktsniffer.parse_args()¶

Method for parsing command line arguments.

Return args:

Namespace storing all the parsed arguments.

pktsniffer.safe(pkt, attr_path, default='N/A')¶

Method to safely get nested attributes from packet layers.

Parameters:

  • pkt – Current packet

  • attr_path – example: ‘ip.src’ or ‘tcp.srcport’

  • default – Default return in case of errors/attribute not found

Returns:

Object containing attribute path if exists, N/A otherwise

pktsniffer.summarize_packet(pkt)¶

Method to print one human-readable summary for the given packet (Ethernet, IP, transport).

Parameters:

pkt – Current Packet

Returns:

None
